formula:
1. Angle traced by the minute hand in an hour = 360°
    Angle traced by the hour hand in an hour = 30°
    Angle traced by the minute hand in x minutes = 6x°
    Angle traced by the hour hand in x minutes = (x/2)°

2. Minute Spaces:
The face or dial of a watch is a circle whose circumference is divided into 60 equal parts, called minute spaces.

In an hour, the minute hand travels 60 minute spaces and the hour hand travels 5 minute spaces. Hence, the minute hand gains 55 minute spaces over the hour hand in an hour.

When the hands of a clock are x minute spaces apart, they are inclined at 6x°.

3. Both the hands coincide once every 65(5/11) minutes. 
          22 times in a day.

4. When the hands lie in a straight line in opposite directions, they are 30 minute spaces apart.
           22 times a day.

5. When the hands of a clock are at right angles, they are 15 minute spaces apart. 
           44 times in a day.

problems.question: How often do the hour hand and minute hand of a clock coincide?
problems.solution:
The hour hand and minute hand coincide 11 times in 12 hours (720 minutes)

They coincide every 720/11 = 65(5/11) minutes

problems.question: If the minute hand of a clock has moved 300°, how many degrees has the hour hand moved?
problems.solution:
When the minute hand moves 360°, the hour hand moves 30°

When the minute hand moves 300°, the hour hand moves 
30*300/360 = 25°

problems.question: A clock when seen through a mirror shows 4:40. What is the correct time?
problems.solution:
Since the hour hand is between 4 and 5 in the mirror, it should be between 7 and 8 in the real image.

Hence, the correct time is 7:20

problems.question: Find the angle between the hour hand and minute hand of the clock when the time is 6:10.
problems.solution:
Angle traced by the hour hand in 60 minutes 
= 30°
Angle traced by the hour hand in 6 hrs 10 minutes (370 mins) 
= 370*30/60 = 185°
Angle traced by the minute hand in 60 minutes 
= 360°
Angle traced by the minute hand in 10 minutes 
= 10*360/60 = 60°
Angle between the hour hand and minute hand 
= 185°- 60° = 125°

problems.question: At what time, in minutes, between 3'o clock and 4'o clock do the hands of the clock point in opposite directions?
problems.solution:
At 3'o clock, the hands of the clock are 15 minute spaces apart.

When they lie in opposite directions, the hands of the clock are 30 minute spaces apart.

The minute hand has to gain 45 minute spaces over the hour hand to lie in opposite directions.

55 minute spaces are gained in 60 minutes.

45 minute spaces are gained in
45*60/55 = 49(1/11) minutes

problems.question: A clock is started at noon. By 10 minutes past 5, the hour hand has turned through
problems.solution:
Angle traced in 5 hrs 10 mins (310 minutes) 
= 310/2 = 155°

problems.question: The angle between the hour hand and minute hand of a clock when the time is 8:40
problems.solution:
Angle traced by the hour hand in 8 hrs 40 minutes (520 mins) 
= 520/2 = 260°
Angle traced by the minute hand in 40 minutes 
= 40*6 = 240°
Angle between the hour hand and minute hand 
= 260°- 240° = 20°

problems.question: At what time, in minutes, between 6'o clock and 7'o clock do the hour hand and minute hand of the clock coincide?
problems.solution:
The hour hand and minute hand coincide every 65(5/11) minutes. They coincide at 12'o clock. 

Between 6 and 7, they coincide at 
6*5(5/11) = 360/11 = 32(8/11) minutes

problems.question: A clock loses 2 seconds every minute. If the clock was set to the correct time at 10 in the morning, find the time shown by the clock when the correct time is 5:00 pm.
problems.solution:
The clock loses 2 seconds every min. Hence, it loses two minutes in an hour.

In 7 hours (10:00 am to 5:00 pm), the clock loses 14 minutes.

At 5:00 pm, the clock shows 4:46 pm.

problems.question: How many times in a day do the hands of a clock lie in a straight line?
problems.solution:
No. of times the hands coincide = 22

No. of times the hands lie in opposite directions = 22

They lie in a straight line 44 times.

problems.question: A clock takes 10 seconds to strike 5. How much time will it take to strike 10?
problems.solution:
The first strike takes place at the zeroth second and the time count starts after that.

The next 4 strikes take 10 seconds.

Time for a strike = 10/4 = 2.5 seconds

Time taken to strike 10
= Time for 9 strikes
= 9*2.5
= 22.5 seconds

problems.question: At noon, the minute hand was pointing to the West. To which direction will the hour hand point at 7:30 pm if the clock stayed in the same position?
problems.solution:
N
WE
S

At 12 noon, both the hands point to the West.

At 7:30 pm, the hour hand lies to the middle of South and East i.e South-East

problems.question: The reflex angle between the hands of the clock at 9:30 is
problems.solution:
A reflex angle measures between 180° and 360°.

Angle traced in 9 hrs 30 mins (570 minutes) 
= 570/2 = 285°

Angle traced by minute hand in 30 minutes
= 30*6 = 180°

Angle between the hour hand and minute hand
= 285°-180°
= 105°
Reflex angle between them
= 360°-105°
= 255°

problems.question: Find the angle between the hands of the clock when the time is 20 minutes past 7.
problems.solution:
Angle traced in 7 hrs 20 mins (440 minutes) 
= 440/2 = 220°

Angle traced by minute hand in 20 minutes
= 20*6 = 120°

Angle between the hour hand and minute hand
= 220°-120°
= 100°

problems.question: At what time, in minutes, between 5 and 6'o clock will the hands of the clock be at right angles for the first time?
problems.solution:
At 5'o clock, the hour hand is 25 minute spaces ahead of the minute hand.

To be at right angles, they should be 15 minute spaces apart.

The minute hand has to gain 10 minute spaces over the hour hand.

55 minute spaces are gained in 60 minutes.
10 minute spaces are gained in
(60/55)*10 = 120/11
   = 10(10/11) minutes

problems.question: How many times in a day are the hands of the clock at right angles?
problems.solution:
The hands of the clock are at right angles 22 times in 12 hours.

Hence, they are at right angles 44 times in a day.

problems.question: Find the times between 3 and 4'o clock, correct to the nearest minute, when the hands of the clock at at 60° degrees.
problems.solution:
At 3'o clock, the hour hand is 15 minute spaces ahead of the minute hand.

To be inclined at 60°, the hands of the clock should be 60/6=10 minute spaces apart.

This is possible in two ways
(i) Minute hand gains 5 minute spaces(15-10) over the hour hand.
(ii) Minute hand gains 25 minute spaces(15+10) over the hour hand.

55 minute spaces are gained in 60 minutes.
5 minute spaces are gained in
(60/55)*5 = 60/11
 = 5(5/11) minutes
25 minute spaces are gained in
(60/55)*25 = 300/11
   = 27(3/11)

problems.question: A watch shows 9:00 am. Through how many degrees will the hour hand rotate when the watch shows 6:00 pm on the same day?
problems.solution:
Angle traced by the hour hand in an hour
= 30°
Angle traced in 9 hours(9:00 am-6:00 pm)
= 270°

problems.question: The hour hand and minute hand are 28 minute spaces apart. If the time is between 1 and 2'o clock, find the exact time.
problems.solution:
At 1'o clock, the hour hand is 5 minute spaces ahead of the minute spaces.

To be 28 minute spaces apart,
the minute hand has to gain 33 minute spaces over the hour hand.

33 minute spaces are gained in
(60/55)*33 = 36 minutes

problems.question: Between 7 and 8'o clock, at what time will the hands of the clock be inclined at 78° for the first time?
problems.solution:
To be inclined at 78°, the hands of the clock should be (78/6)=13 minute spaces apart.

At 7'o clock, the hour hand is 35 minute spaces ahead of the minute hand.

This is possible in two ways
(i) Minute hand gains 22 minute spaces(35-13) over the hour hand.
(ii) Minute hand gains 48 minute spaces(35+13) over the hour hand.

First case is alone sufficient for this question.

55 minute spaces are gained in 60 minutes.
22 minute spaces are gained in
(60/55)*22 = 24 minutes

problems.question: A watch which gains time uniformly is 2 minutes slow at 10 am on Sunday and is 4 min 48 sec fast at noon on the following Sunday. When was it correct?
problems.solution:
Time from 10 am on Sunday to 12 pm the next Sunday
= (24*7)+2
= 170 hours
The watch gained (2 min+4 min 48 sec)
= 120+288 sec
= 408 seconds in 170 hours.
It was correct when it gained 2 minutes(120 sec).
408 sec --> 170 hrs
120 sec --> 170*(120/408) 
    = 50 hrs
    = 2 days+2 hrs
It was correct at 12 pm on Tuesday.

problems.question: Two clocks start striking together at noon. The first clock strikes every 3 seconds and the second clock strikes every 2.5 seconds. Find the interval between the seventh strike of the first clock and the fifth strike of the second clock.
problems.solution:
The clocks start striking at the zeroth second.

First strike - 0th second

Seventh strike of first clock
6*3 = 18 seconds
Fifth strike of second clock
4*2.5 = 10 seconds
Time interval
8 seconds

problems.question: A clock is set right at noon. The clock loses 16 minutes in 24 hours. What will be the true time when the clock shows 5 a.m. on the fifth day?
problems.solution:
Time from 12 pm on the first day to 5 am on the fifth day
= 12+(24*3)+5
= 89 hours
The clock loses 16 minutes in 24 hours

23 hrs 44 mins of this clock
= 24 hrs of correct clock
23 hrs 44 mins
= 23+(44/60) hrs
= 23+(11/15) hrs
= 356/15 hrs
356/15 hrs of this clock
= 24 hrs of correct clock
89 hrs of this clock
= 24*(15/365)*89
= 90 hrs of correct clock
So the correct time is 6 a.m.

problems.question: How many times in a day do the hands of the clock lie in opposite directions forming a straight line?
problems.solution:
They lie in opposite directions in a straight line 11 times in 12 hours.

Hence, 22 times in a day.

problems.question: A watch which gains 5 seconds every 3 minutes was set right at 9 a.m. What is the true time when the watch shows 6:15 p.m. that evening?
problems.solution:
Time from 9 a.m. to 6:15 p.m.
= 9 hours 15 minutes
= 555 minutes

3 minutes 5 seconds of this clock
= 3 minutes of correct clock

185 seconds of this clock
= 180 seconds of correct clock

1 minute of this clock
= (180/185) minutes of correct clock

555 minutes of this clock
= (180/185)*555
= 540 minutes
= 9 hours of correct clock
Correct time is 6 p.m.

problems.question: A clock shows 7:15. When seen through a mirror, what time does it show?
problems.solution: The hour hand will be between 4 and 5 and minute hand will point to 9. Hence, the clock in the mirror shows 4:45.

problems.question: At 10:30, the hour hand and minute hand form an angle of
problems.solution:
Angle traced by the hour hand in 10 hrs 30 mins (630 minutes) 
= 630/2 = 315°

Angle traced by minute hand in 30 minutes
= 30*6 = 180°

Angle between the hour hand and minute hand
= 315°-180°
= 135°

problems.question: The difference between the hour hand and minute hand of a clock is 12 minute spaces. The time is between 2 p.m. and 3 p.m. Find the exact time.
problems.solution:
At 2'o clock, the hour hand is 10 minute spaces ahead of the minute hand.

To be 12 minute spaces apart, the minute hand has to gain 22 minute spaces(10+12) over the hour hand.

55 minute spaces are gained in 60 minutes.
22 minute spaces are gained in
(60/55)*22 = 24 minutes

problems.question: The hour hand of a clock has moved 12°. How many degress has the minute hand moved?
problems.solution:
When the hour hand moves 30°, the minute hand moves 360°

When the hour hand moves 12°, the minute hand moves 
360*12/30 = 144°

problems.question: At what time, in minutes, between 12'o clock and 1'o clock do the hour hand and minute hand of the clock lie in opposite directions?
problems.solution:
To lie in opposite directions, the minute hand has to gain 30 minute spaces over the hour hand.


55 minute spaces are gained in 60 minutes.
30 minute spaces are gained in
(60/55)*30 = 32(8/11) mins

problems.question: When asked what the time is, a person answered that the amount of time left is 1/5 of the time already completed. What is the time?
problems.solution:
Let the time be x hours.

(24-x) = x/5

120-5x=x

x=20

The time is 8 pm.

problems.question: The famous church in the city of Kumbakonnam has a big clock tower and is said to be over 300 years old. Every Monday 10 A.M. the clock is set by Antony, doing service in the church. The Clock loses 6 mins every hour. What will be the actual time when the faulty clock shows 10 P.M. on Friday?
problems.solution:
Time passed in the clock
= 24+24+24+24+12
= 108 hours
54 minutes of the fauly clock
= 60 minutes of correct clock
1 min of faulty clock
= (60/54) mins of correct clock
108 hours of faulty clock
= 108*(60/54) hours
= 120 hours
The correct time is 10 AM on Saturday.

problems.question: A clock is set right at 5 am. The clock loses 16 minutes in 24 hours. What will be the true time when theclock indicates 10 pm on the 4th day?
problems.solution:
Time from 5 am on the 1st day to 10 pm on the 4th day
= (24*3)+17
= 89 hours

Time lost in 89 hours
= 16*89/24
= 59.33

The true time will approximately be 11 pm.

problems.question: Each hour, a watch slows down by 30 seconds. It is set to the correct time at 8 a.m. What time does the watch show at 8 p.m?
problems.solution:
Time lost in 12 hours
= 12*0.5
= 6 minutes

The watch shows 7:54 pm.

problems.question: The acute angle between the hour hand and minute hand of a clock at 4 PM is
A clock gains 5 minutes in 24 hours. It was set right at 10 am on Monday. What will be the true time when the clock indicates 10:30 am on the next Sunday?
problems.solution:
The clock gains 5 minutes every day.

Hence, it gains 30 minutes in 6 days.

When it shows 10.30 am on Sunday, the true time is 10.00 am.
